model_classes

(thermal_history.model_classes)

class BaseModel(method_module=None)[source]

Bases: object

Base class from which each class associated with regions of the planet (core, stable layer, mantle etc) inherits from.

model_type

String denoting the model type for internal checking

Type:

string

ys

Number of seconds in a year, commonly used constant.

Type:

float

parameters

Placeholder for parameters class, unless the region is not modelled in which case it is left as None.

Type:

None

evolve(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Defines evolve() based on the specific method in __init__().

setup(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Defines setup() based on the specific method in __init__().

state()[source]

Creates dictionary with all attributes. The current ‘state’ of the model. This retrieves all attributes of the model class, with exceptions listed in the ‘ignore_list’ variable, and returns them in a dictionary. Used primarily for producing a dictionary of values to save.

Returns:

Dictionary containing model attributes (minus those ignored)

Return type:

state

update(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Defines update() based on the specific method in __init__().

class ThermalModel(parameters, methods, verbose=True, log_file='out.log', log_level=30)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Main thermal history model class. Contains the primary methods for calculating the evolution of the planet. This is the main class the user interacts with.

model_type

String denoting the model type for internal checking

Type:

string

time

Current time of the model. Initialised at zero by default and incrimented by the time step whenever evolve() is called.

Type:

float

it

Iteration number (starts at 1)

Type:

int

append_to_save_dict()[source]

Append latest model data to the save_dict

evolve(dt, print_freq=100, verbose=True)[source]

Evolve the model one timestep.

When this is called, the evolve method for each region is called, results are appended to the save_dict and the update method for each region is called.

Parameters:

  • dt (Float) – Time step for the model iteration (seconds)

  • print_freq (int, optional) – Number of iterations between progress messages printed to screen, by default 100

Raises:

ValueError – If a negative step time is used when a stable layer is being solved for. Diffusion requires dt>0.

print_progress()[source]

Print progress to STDOUT

save_dict_to_numpy_array()[source]

Convert the lists in save_dict to numpy arrays

Returns:

Copy of save_dict except that all values are converted to numpy arrays.

Return type:

Dict

setup_save_dict()[source]

Setup the dictionary that holds all data to be saved, stored as the save_dict attribute.

Notes

Only integers, floating point numbers and numpy arrays will be saved. Furthermore, the profiles are not saved since they take a lot of memory. If you would like to save the profiles at each time-step, this can be done manually after the users calls ThermalModel.evolve() at each timestep.

state()[source]

Create dictionary of current variables in the model.

This retrieves all attributes of all model classes contained with the ThermalModel by calling their state() methods and returns them in a dictionary.

Returns:

Dictionary containing all attributes for all regions being modelled

Return type:

Dict

update()[source]

Calls update methods for each region and save to model classes

warnings(verbose=True)[source]

returns the number of warnings generated in the log file.

Parameters:

verbose (bool, optional) – print out each warning, by default True

Returns:

number of warnings

Return type:

int

write_data(fname, overwrite=False, verbose=True)[source]

Writes the model data to a binary file.

The parameters and final profiles will be added to the save_dict which is then written to a binary file using pickle. The time at which this function is called is also added to the parameters. The save_dict is also passed through save_dict_to_numpy_array() to convert all values to numpy arrays first.

Parameters:

  • fname (Str) – Name of the output file (.pik will be appended if not already included)

  • overwrite (Bool, optional) – If True will overwrite existing files with the same name, otherwise an error will be raised, by default False.

  • verbose (Bool, optional) – If True will print to screen a confirmation of the name of the file that has been saved, by default True.

Raises:

ValueError – If a file with the same name already exists.

write_profiles(fname, overwrite=False, verbose=True)[source]

Writes the radial profiles from the current timestep to a binary file.

The parameters will be added to the dictionary containing the profiles which is then written to a binary file using pickle. The time at which this function is called is also added to the parameters.

Parameters:

  • fname (Str) – Name of the output file (.pik will be appended if not already included)

  • overwrite (Bool, optional) – If True will overwrite existing files with the same name, otherwise an error will be raised, by default False.

  • verbose (Bool, optional) – If True will print to screen a confirmation of the name of the file that has been saved, by default True.

Raises:

ValueError – If a file with the same name already exists.
